itemDescription: Acting Bishop of Leicester; Bishop of Brixworth

wikipedia_page.main: John Edward Holbrook (born 14 June 1962) is a Church of England bishop. He is the Bishop of Brixworth in the Diocese of Peterborough. He had been Rural Dean of Wimborne in the Diocese of Salisbury and served as Acting Bishop of Leicester (of the Diocese of Leicester).

response: The Bishop of Peterborough (Donald Allister) leads the diocese, and is assisted by the Bishop suffragan of Brixworth (John Holbrook). The suffragan see of Brixworth was created by Order in Council on 26 July 1988.
|align=center|1 September 2015||align=center|22 February 2016 ||| 60px John Holbrook || Bishop of Brixworth, acting bishopDiocese of Leicester — Interim Bishop of Leicester (Accessed 30 June 2015)
The role is currently held by John HolbrookNumber 10 — Suffragan See of Brixworth since his 2 June 2011 consecration.
